controlIdentifiers.Name: Disallow Internet connection via RDP
controlIdentifiers.Description: Reduces a server's exposure to risk by removing unfettered connectivity to remote console services such as RDP.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Detect whether any Amazon EC2 instance has an associated public IPv4 address
controlIdentifiers.Description: Detects whether an Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance has an associated public IPv4 address. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the public IP field is present in the Amazon EC2 instance configuration item. This guardrail applies only to IPv4 addresses.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if security groups restrict incoming traffic to restricted ports explicitly from 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if security groups restrict incoming traffic to restricted ports explicitly from 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if security groups allow incoming traffic from 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 over TCP/UDP ports 22/3389 or as specified in parameters.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if your Amazon EC2 instances are managed by AWS Systems Manager (SSM Agent)
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if your Amazon EC2 instances are managed by AWS Systems Manager (SSM Agent). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the EC2 instance previously associated with an SSM Agent instance inventory becomes unreachable or is not managed by SSM Agent.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Enable encryption for EBS volumes attached to EC2 instances
controlIdentifiers.Description: Secure EBS volumes attached to EC2 instances through encryption.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Detect whether any Amazon VPC subnets are assigned a public IP address
controlIdentifiers.Description: Detects whether Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) subnets are assigned a public IP address. The rule is COMPLIANT if Amazon VPC does not have subnets that are assigned a public IP address. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Amazon VPC has subnets that are assigned a public IP address.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS) encryption is enabled by default
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS) encryption is enabled by default. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the encryption is not enabled.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Disallow public access to RDS database snapshots
controlIdentifiers.Description: Secure your Amazon RDS database snapshots by disallowing public access.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Disallow public access to RDS database instances
controlIdentifiers.Description: Secure your Amazon RDS database instances by disallowing public access.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if RDS DB instances are deployed in a public subnet with a route to the internet gateway
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if RDS DB instances are deployed in a public subnet with a route to the internet gateway. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if RDS DB instances is deployed in a public subnet

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) cluster has deletion protection enabled
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) cluster has deletion protection enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Amazon RDS cluster does not have deletion protection enabled.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) instance has deletion protection enabled
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) instance has deletion protection enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Amazon RDS instance does not have deletion protection enabled; for example, deletionProtection is set to false.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if connections to Amazon RDS for MySQL database instances are configured to use encryption in transit
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if connections to Amazon RDS for MySQL database instances are configured to use encryption in transit. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the associated database parameter group is not in-sync or if the require_secure_transport parameter is not set to 1.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks whether high availability is enabled for your RDS DB instances
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks whether high availability is enabled for your RDS DB instances.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Disallow RDS database instances without storage encryption
controlIdentifiers.Description: Secure your Amazon RDS database instances at rest by encrypting the underlying storage for database instances and their automated backups, Read Replicas, and snapshots.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if Multi-Availability Zone (Multi-AZ) replication is enabled on Amazon Aurora and Multi-AZ DB clusters managed by Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS)
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if Multi-Availability Zone (Multi-AZ) replication is enabled on Amazon Aurora and Multi-AZ DB clusters managed by Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an Amazon RDS instance is not configured with Multi-AZ.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Disallow public write access to S3 buckets
controlIdentifiers.Description: Secure access to data stored in Amazon S3 buckets by disallowing public writes.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Disallow public read access to S3 buckets
controlIdentifiers.Description: Secure access to data stored in Amazon S3 buckets by disallowing public reads.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if Amazon S3 access points have block public access settings enabled
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if Amazon S3 access points have block public access settings enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if block public access settings are not enabled for S3 access points.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks whether the required public access block settings are configured from account level
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks whether the required public access block settings are configured from account level. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT when the public access block settings are not configured from account level.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if S3 buckets are publicly accessible
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if S3 buckets are publicly accessible. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an S3 bucket is not listed in the excludedPublicBuckets parameter and bucket level settings are public.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if S3 buckets have policies that require requests to use SSL/TLS
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if S3 buckets have policies that require requests to use SSL/TLS. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if any S3 bucket has policies allowing HTTP requests.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if Amazon CloudWatch alarms actions are in enabled state
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if Amazon CloudWatch alarms actions are in enabled state. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the CloudWatch alarms actions are not in enabled state.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if Amazon CloudWatch Log Groups are encrypted with any AWS KMS key or a specified AWS KMS key Id
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if Amazon CloudWatch Log Groups are encrypted with any AWS KMS key or a specified AWS KMS key Id. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if a CloudWatch Log Group is not encrypted with a KMS key or is encrypted with a KMS key not supplied in the rule parameter.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Detect whether the AWS Lambda function policy attached to the Lambda resource blocks public access
controlIdentifiers.Description: Detects whether the AWS Lambda function policy attached to the Lambda resource prohibits public access. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Lambda function policy allows public access.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if a Lambda function is allowed access to a virtual private cloud (VPC)
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if a Lambda function is allowed access to a virtual private cloud (VPC). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the Lambda function is not VPC enabled.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if point-in-time recovery (PITR) is enabled for Amazon DynamoDB tables
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if point-in-time recovery (PITR) is enabled for Amazon DynamoDB tables. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if PITR is not enabled for DynamoDB tables.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks whether Amazon DynamoDB table is encrypted with AWS Key Management Service (KMS)
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks whether Amazon DynamoDB table is encrypted with AWS Key Management Service (KMS). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if Amazon DynamoDB table is not encrypted with AWS KMS.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if an Amazon DynamoDB table have deletion protection set to enabled
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if an Amazon DynamoDB table have deletion protection set to enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the table have deletion protection set to disabled.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks whether the Amazon DynamoDB tables are encrypted and checks their status
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks whether the Amazon DynamoDB tables are encrypted and checks their status. The rule is compliant if the status is enabled or enabling.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if the SQS queue access policy allows public access
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if the SQS queue access policy allows public access. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the SQS queue access policy allows public access.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if the SQS queue access policy allows full access
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if the SQS queue access policy allows full access. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the SQS policy contains `SQS:*` within `Action` and `Effect` is `Allow`.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if SNS topics are encrypted with AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS)
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if SNS topics are encrypted with AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if an SNS topic is not encrypted with AWS KMS. Optionally, specify the key ARNs, the alias ARNs, the alias name, or the key IDs for the rule to check.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if Amazon Elastic Container Service clusters have container insights enabled
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if Amazon Elastic Container Service clusters have container insights enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if container insights are not enabled.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) Containers only have read-only access to its root filesystems
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if Amazon Elastic Container Service (Amazon ECS) Containers only have read-only access to its root filesystems. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the readonlyRootFilesystem parameter in the container definition of ECSTaskDefinitions is set to 'false'.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if a private Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR) repository has image scanning enabled
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if a private Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR) repository has image scanning enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the private ECR repository's scan frequency is not on scan on push or continuous scan.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if a private Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR) repository has at least one lifecycle policy configured
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if a private Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR) repository has at least one lifecycle policy configured. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if no lifecycle policy is configured for the ECR private repository.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if the root user access key is available
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if the root user access key is available. The rule is COMPLIANT if the user access key does not exist. Otherwise, NON_COMPLIANT.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks whether the default version of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) policies do not have administrator access
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks whether the default version of AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) policies do not have administrator access. If any statement has "Effect": "Allow" with "Action": "*" over "Resource": "*", the rule is non-compliant.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Disallow access to IAM users without MFA
controlIdentifiers.Description: Protect your account by requiring multi-factor authentication (MFA) for any AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user using the account. MFA adds an extra authentication code on top of a user name and password.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Disallow console access to IAM users without MFA
controlIdentifiers.Description: Protect your account by requiring multi-factor authentication (MFA) for any AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user using the console. MFA adds an extra authentication code on top of a user name and password.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if the account password policy for AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users meets the specified requirements indicated in the parameters
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if the account password policy for AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users meets the specified requirements indicated in the parameters. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the account password policy does not meet the specified requirements.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if listeners for the load balancers are configured with HTTPS or TLS termination
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if listeners for the load balancers are configured with HTTPS or TLS termination. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if listeners are not configured with HTTPS or TLS termination.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if an Elastic Load Balancer has deletion protection enabled
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if an Elastic Load Balancer has deletion protection enabled. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if deletion_protection.enabled is false.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if Application Load Balancers and Network Load Balancers are configured to use certificates from Amazon Certificate Manager (ACM)
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if Application Load Balancers and Network Load Balancers are configured to use certificates from Amazon Certificate Manager (ACM). This rule is NON_COMPLIANT if at least 1 load balancer is configured without a certificate from ACM.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks whether HTTP to HTTPS redirection is configured on all HTTP listeners of Application Load Balancers
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks whether HTTP to HTTPS redirection is configured on all HTTP listeners of Application Load Balancers. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if one or more HTTP listeners of Application Load Balancer do not have HTTP to HTTPS redirection configured.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if AWS WAF is enabled on Application Load Balancers (ALBs)
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if AWS WAF is enabled on Application Load Balancers (ALBs). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if key: waf.enabled is set to false.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if rule evaluates AWS Application Load Balancers (ALB) to ensure they are configured to drop http headers
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if rule evaluates AWS Application Load Balancers (ALB) to ensure they are configured to drop http headers. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the value of routing.http.drop_invalid_header_fields.enabled is set to false.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if your Amazon CloudFront distributions use HTTPS (directly or via a redirection)
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if your Amazon CloudFront distributions use HTTPS (directly or via a redirection). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the value of ViewerProtocolPolicy is set to 'allow-all' for the DefaultCacheBehavior or for the CacheBehaviors.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if logging is enabled on AWS WAFv2 regional and global web access control lists (web ACLs)
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if logging is enabled on AWS WAFv2 regional and global web access control lists (web ACLs). The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the logging is enabled but the logging destination does not match the value of the parameter.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if the project contains environment variables AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID and AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if the project contains environment variables AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID and AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT when the project environment variables contains plaintext credentials.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if the Bitbucket source repository URL contains sign-in credentials or not
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if the Bitbucket source repository URL contains sign-in credentials or not. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if the URL contains any sign-in information and COMPLIANT if it doesn't.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if AWS CodeDeploy deployment groups automatically update outdated instances
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if AWS CodeDeploy deployment groups automatically update outdated instances. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if configuration.outdatedInstancesStrategy is 'IGNORE'.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Checks if the deployment group is configured with automatic deployment rollback and deployment monitoring with alarms attached
controlIdentifiers.Description: Checks if the deployment group is configured with automatic deployment rollback and deployment monitoring with alarms attached. The rule is NON_COMPLIANT if AutoRollbackConfiguration or AlarmConfiguration has not been configured or is not enabled.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Disallow all public sharing of Amazon EBS snapshots
controlIdentifiers.Description: This control blocks the public sharing of your Amazon EBS snapshots by configuring block public access for Amazon EBS snapshot settings at an account level. This setting has the effect of preventing all public sharing of your EBS snapshots, so that snapshots that previously were publicly shared are treated as private, and are no longer publicly available.

controlIdentifiers.Name: Disallow public sharing of Amazon Machine Images (AMIs)
controlIdentifiers.Description: This control prevents the public sharing of your AMIs by configuring block public access for AMIs at an account level. If you already have public AMIs, they remain publicly available.
